isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - CENTER HOOD GUIDE

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Center Hood Guide Adjustment Side to Side
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 99 for all Items in parentheses.
To adjust the center hood guide (Item 1) side to side at the center of the hood to align the upper sides of the hood with the sides of the cab cowl, use the following procedure.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly enough to adjust the center hood guide.
Loosen, but do not remove, the adjustment bolts (Item 2) that secure the center hood guide (Item 1) to the hood. Adjust the center hood guide side to side on the slotted holes, as required.
Hold the center hood guide (Item 1) in place and tighten adjustment bolts (Item 2).
Lower the hood to the closed position and latch the hood on each side. Check the alignment of the upper sides of the hood with the sides of the cab cowl.
If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure. Also refer to 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Center Hood Guide Support Adjustment Side to Side.
